myMath

Class Monom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Monom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    function

    public class Monom
extends java.lang.Object
implements function
    This class represents a simple "Monom" of shape a*x^b, where a is a real number and a is an integer (summed a none negative), see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monomial The class implements function and support simple operations as: construction, value at x, derivative, add and multiply.
    Author:
    Boaz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Monom(double a, int b)
      Constructor - sets the coefficient of the monom to DOUBLE a and INT b
      Monom(Monom ot)
      Copy constructor - creates a new Monom with the coefficient and power of Monom ot

      Coefficient getter
      int get_power()
      Power getter
      Monom ifMultiplied(Monom m1)
      ifMultiplied - a function to virtually multiply monoms - the monom itself will not change but will return the result of this multiplication as a new Monom
      void multiply(Monom m1)
      Multiplies the monom with another monom
      void reverseMonom()
      Multiplies the monom by -1, f(x) => -f(x)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Monom m1)
        Checks if two monoms are equal
        Parameters:
        m1 - - Monom to compare
        Returns:
        returns TRUE if the Monoms have an equal coefficient AND power. Returns FALSE otherwise.

      • ifMultiplied

        public Monom ifMultiplied(Monom m1)
        ifMultiplied - a function to virtually multiply monoms - the monom itself will not change but will return the result of this multiplication as a new Monom
        Parameters:
        m1 - - the Monom to virtually multiply
        Returns:
        returns a new Monom, the result of the multiplication
